intro: Gonolobus ottonis, commonly known as the Otto's morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant features heart-shaped, palmate leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its vines can grow up to several meters in length, often climbing or trailing along supports. The flowers bloom in the morning and close by midday, giving the plant its common name.
